description: Two-level teacher skill progression used by School Coaching Managers. Level 1 skills are foundational (what every teacher should do); Level 2 skills represent deeper, more advanced practice. Organized by instructional domain and sub-domain.

skills.name: Complete Mastery Checks
skills.description: Teacher completes all unit mastery checks on Podsie prior to unit launch

skills.name: Complete Assessment(s)
skills.description: Teacher completes all unit assessments on Podsie prior to unit launch

skills.name: Complete Unit Unpack Protocol
skills.description: Teacher completes Unit Unpack protocol to prepare for the unit (this does not exist yet, digitally)

skills.name: Prepare Fluency Materials
skills.description: Teacher preps and prints all fluency sheets for the following week

skills.name: Complete Number Strings Internalization
skills.description: Teacher completes intellectual preparation to lead number strings lesson(s) (this is in process of being designed now)

skills.name: Prepare SGI Materials
skills.description: Print practice problems for each student, have worked example visible, gather other tools/anchor charts

skills.name: Select Students for Small Group
skills.description: Teacher uses Podsie to select students for Small Group Instruction (this will soon be automated?)

skills.name: Complete Worked Example and Practice Problems
skills.description: Teacher completes worked example and practice problems as a student

skills.name: Prepare for CFU (Check for Understanding)
skills.description: Know exemplar response to CFU questions

skills.name: Prepare to Respond to Student Errors
Prepare Inquiry Materials
skills.description: Teacher preps and prints all inquiry materials needed for every inquiry group planned (markers, chart paper, etc.).

skills.name: Select Students for Inquiry Groups
skills.description: Teacher uses Podsie to select students for Inquiry Groups (this will soon be automated?)

skills.name: Complete Inquiry Task(s)
skills.description: Teacher completes inquiry task(s) as a student

skills.name: Review Answer Key for Misconceptions & Backup Questions (Hints and Extensions)
skills.description: Teacher reviews answer key for key concepts, precise math terminology, potential misconceptions, and prepares a similar-but-easier question for stuck groups and to push for multiple representations

skills.name: Review Student Work on Podsie/Mathly
skills.description: Teacher looks at individual student work on Podsie to determine who did/did not complete a mastery check, who is stuck on a mastery check, and to consider who should be in small groups and for 1:1 coaching

skills.name: Greeting Every Student by Name
skills.description: Teacher greets every student, by name, as they enter the classroom

skills.name: Minute Drills
skills.description: Teacher introduces fluency practice using challenge and timer

skills.name: Lead Whole Class Warm Up: Released NYSE Question
skills.description: Teacher uses a spiral review question (i.e. NYSE released item) to review a key concept/standard/misconception the large majority of the class is struggling with

skills.name: Attendance & Lesson Completion Data Share
skills.description: Teacher shares attendance and lesson completion data from previous day, including class-wide trends and individual data (i.e., lesson completion, Podsie completion, etc.).

skills.name: 1:1 Data Conversations with Students
skills.description: Teacher holds 1:1 data conversations with students during the lesson to discuss their current performance level and to set goals for growth

skills.name: Individual & Class Celebrations
skills.description: Teacher leads authentic and joyful celebration for individual student growth and/or achievement, student of the day, assessment growth, etc.

skills.name: Work Time Goal
skills.description: Teacher builds whole class investment by sharing class-wide goal for the day ("Today, our class goal is for everyone to finish Lesson 5!").

skills.name: Gathering Materials Routine & Procedure
skills.description: Teacher cues transition to independent work time (transition to get materials, open laptops, etc). Teacher plays calm music to create focused work environment.

skills.name: Set Up Physical Environment for Learning
skills.description: Sets up seating arrangement and materials so students can see the teacher and the worked example and the teacher can easily monitor students when they work on their own

skills.name: Use Visual Anchors
skills.description: Displays and uses visual anchors (anchor charts, reference sheets, vocabulary supports) to help students understand content.

skills.name: Explain Steps of a Worked Example in Sequential Order
skills.description: Follows the slides to break multiple step of the Worked Example problem into sequential, logically ordered steps.

skills.name: Articulate & Stamp the Big Idea of Worked Example
skills.description: Articulate key learning in transferable terms

skills.name: Use Precise Mathematical Vocabulary
skills.description: Convey content using precise mathematical terminology

skills.name: Use Concise Language
skills.description: Use only necessary words and steps; do not include details students do not need.

skills.name: Accurately Explain Mathematical Concepts
skills.description: Conveys mathematical content accurately

skills.name: Ask Check for Understanding Questions about Worked Example
skills.description: Following the slides, the teacher asks questions to check for understanding at strategic points during the Worked Example

skills.name: Use Teacher Wait Time
skills.description: Teacher provides wait time for responses before posing a new question, moving on, or unpacking a misconception

skills.name: Facilitate Student-to-Student Relationships
skills.description: Create structures and opportunities for students to interact positively with each other.

skills.name: Normalize Mistakes as Learning
skills.description: Explicitly state that errors are part of learning and respond to mistakes or misconceptions as opportunities to learn

skills.name: Promote Growth Mindset
skills.description: Frame ability as developable through effort

skills.name: Lead Turn & Talk / Partner Discussion
skills.description: Lead a turn and talk and short group conversation to address misconceptions/errors.

skills.name: Facilitate Student Independent Practice
skills.description: Support students as they work on their problem on their own

skills.name: Notice Student Error & Prompt to Use Worked Example
skills.description: Review student work as students are working on their own, identify when they have a misconception or error, and prompt students to use the worked example to support them

skills.name: Respond 1:1 to Student Error
skills.description: Respond 1:1 to students to address error/misconception. Use questioning to help students unpack their error.

skills.name: State Inquiry Norms Explicitly
skills.description: Teacher explicitly states norms: "Everyone speaks, everyone writes, anyone can explain team's strategies"

skills.name: Inquiry Happens Only During Double Blocks
skills.description: (When only one teacher) Happens only during double block periods (where one period implements small groups & other period implements inquiry)

skills.name: Inquiry Happens During All Periods (no matter if single or double)
skills.description: (When only one teacher) Small groups & inquiry groups happen concurrently during class

skills.name: Check In After ~5 Minutes
skills.description: Teacher checks in with groups after approximately 5 minutes of work time and provides feedback on process, not answers (e.g., "I notice you're stuck—have you re-read the problem together?")

skills.name: Monitor for Visible Collaboration
skills.description: Teacher circulates to ensure all students are writing (all marker colors visible) and that clear strategies—not just answers—are visible on chart paper

skills.name: Facilitate Use of "Understanding the Question" Protocol
skills.description: When students are stuck, teacher directs them to the Understanding the Question protocol rather than providing hints or answers

skills.name: Use Facilitative Questioning (Not Rescuing)
skills.description: Teacher uses prepared facilitative questions ("What do you think?" "How could you check?" "Does your partner agree?") and resists the urge to explain or solve for students

skills.name: Push Thinking with Teacher Marker
skills.description: Teacher uses a distinct color marker to pose questions, highlight key ideas, or push group thinking forward—without solving or writing steps for students

skills.name: Elevate Student Language with Precise Math Terminology
skills.description: Teacher names and reinforces precise mathematical vocabulary during check-ins and group conversations

skills.name: Cold Call Group Members to Explain
skills.description: Teacher cold calls different group members to explain different parts: what the problem was asking, the team's strategy, and how they solved it

skills.name: Mobilize Knowledge Across Groups
skills.description: Teacher uses structures like gallery walks or fishbowls to highlight and compare strategies across inquiry groups

skills.name: Close Lesson with Urgency
skills.description: Teacher uses timer, competition (i.e. rows competing with each other) and voice modulation to communicate urgency and lead an efficient close to the lesson

skills.name: Lead Efficient & Safe Clean-Up
skills.description: Teacher leads students to clean up materials and transition to the next class in under 2 minutes.

skills.name: Close Lesson with Celebrations
skills.description: Teacher celebrate student growth, learning, progress and achievement to close the lesson

skills.name: Student Self-Evaluation
skills.description: Provide time for students to reflect on and evaluate their work quality and identify what they have learned.

skills.name: Address Students by Name
skills.description: Teacher learns 100% of student names and gender pronouns and addresses them, by name, in every interaction

skills.name: Celebrate using Specific Praise
skills.description: Teacher narrates and celebrates by citing specific and observable student/class actions and achievements.

skills.name: Celebrate Whole Class
skills.description: Teacher implements whole-class celebrations (such as student of the day, trophy, and/or whole-class rewards)

skills.name: Assure & Affirm
skills.description: Teacher expresses confidence in student's ability to be successful

skills.name: Build Personal Rapport
skills.description: Show care for students beyond academic content

skills.name: Emotional Regulation
skills.description: Maintain calm, supportive approach consistently throughout interactions

skills.name: Learn About and Value Student Identities
skills.description: Learns about and values the identities and cultures of their students, intentionally incorporating what they know about their students into their teaching

skills.name: Identity Awareness and Self-Reflection
skills.description: Understands how identity and positionality influences their teaching, engages in self-reflection about biases and patterns.

skills.name: Attention Grabber
skills.description: Teacher has a signal they use to consistently gather, grab the attention of 100% of students

skills.name: Specific, Observable Directions
skills.description: Teacher gives clear directions describing specific, observable behaviors they want to see from students.

skills.name: Concise + Sequential Directions
skills.description: Teacher gives directions using as few words as possible. Teacher gives directions in sequential order that students will follow (e.g., "when I say go, first put your pencil down, second...")

skills.name: Rationale
skills.description: Teacher shares the rationale behind directions ("because every minute counts, we will work on our paper passing procedure").

skills.name: Scan & Positive Narration
skills.description: Teacher pauses and looks to see students are following each part of the specific, observable direction. Teacher specifically names the individual student(s) and groups that are meeting a specific part(s) of the given direction(s) immediately following giving a direction.

skills.name: Observable Directions
skills.description: Describe what student success looks and/or sounds like.

skills.name: Multi-Modal Directions
skills.description: Use multiple methods to deliver directions (i.e. verbal + visual, verbal + demonstration, verbal + written, etc.)

skills.name: Student-Led Directions
skills.description: Empower and equip students to help lead and guide directions, including when students are working together without a teacher (i.e. in inquiry groups)

subDomains.name: Teaching and Reinforcing Routines and Procedures

skills.name: Introduce Step-by-Step Classroom Routines
skills.description: Teacher breaks multi-step routines, procedures, or tasks down into sequential, logically ordered steps and explicitly teaches them.

skills.name: Routine or Procedure Practice
skills.description: When introducing a new routine or procedure, teacher facilitates practice with students, such that all students follow the routine + procedure.

skills.name: Build Urgency
skills.description: Teacher uses timers and challenge to build urgency in practice ("Group A put their laptops away in 45 seconds, I wonder if Group B can do it in 40 seconds?").

skills.name: Foster Student Ownership of Culture
skills.description: Involve students in creating and maintaining classroom norms

subDomains.name: Responding When Students Aren't Meeting Expectations

skills.name: Keep Corrections "Off-Stage"
skills.description: When giving individual kids a re-direction, teacher does so privately, quietly and "off stage"

skills.name: Use Proximity (Non-Verbal Cues)
skills.description: Teacher uses physical proximity to student(s) to silently address off-task behavior (standing closer, hand on desk, etc.).

skills.name: Use a Calm Voice, Neutral Language When Addressing Off-Task Behavior
skills.description: Teacher addresses off-task behavior using neutral language and calm voice (can be individual or whole group) in a way that maintains a student's dignity.

skills.name: Positive Redirection
skills.description: Restate the expectation clearly, maintaining a high expectation.

skills.name: Support/Reminder Non-Verbal Cues
skills.description: Use non-verbal physical cues to acknowledge, encourage, or remind students.

skills.name: Anonymous Group Reminders
skills.description: Give a brief, positively framed reminder and/or anonymized statement of encouragement.

skills.name: Curious 1:1 Interaction
skills.description: At the start of an interaction with a student not meeting expectations, ask a question to try to understand their barrier or unmet need.

skills.name: Communicate High Expectations
skills.description: Frame tasks as challenging yet worthy while maintaining rigorous standards

skills.name: Emphasize Collective Success
skills.description: Frame learning as community endeavor where all contribute

skills.name: Encourage Academic Risk-Taking
skills.description: Create conditions where students attempt challenging work safely

skills.name: Model Enthusiasm and Curiosity for Learning
skills.description: Demonstrate genuine excitement and curiosity about content and learning

skills.name: Student Goal-Setting
skills.description: Support students in establishing and tracking goals

skills.name: Normalize Mistakes as Learning
skills.description: Explicitly state that errors are part of learning and respond to mistakes or misconceptions as opportunities to learn

skills.name: Promote Growth Mindset
skills.description: Frame ability as developable through effort

skills.name: Specific, Actionable Feedback
skills.description: Provide clear next steps for improvement tied to standards or success criteria
